cyb70289 commented on a change in pull request #11495:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11495#discussion_r733473420



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/slow.h
##########
@@ -48,7 +48,7 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT LatencyGenerator {
 // XXX use ConcurrencyWrapper?  It could increase chances of finding a race.
 
 template <class StreamType>
-class ARROW_EXPORT SlowInputStreamBase : public StreamType {
+class SlowInputStreamBase : public StreamType {

Review comment:
       This class is implemented completely in header. ARROW_EXPORT expands to `dllimport` in test file, looks clang for windows expects the implementation is at somewhere else and produces link error complaining constructor definition not found.
   
   ```
   NIFESTFILE:release\arrow-io-memory-test.exe.manifest" failed (exit code 1) with the following output:
   lld-link: error: undefined symbol: __declspec(dllimport) public: __cdecl arrow::io::SlowInputStreamBase<class arrow::io::InputStream>::SlowInputStreamBase<class arrow::io::InputStream>(class std::shared_ptr<class arrow::io::InputStream>, double)
   >>> referenced by src\arrow\io\CMakeFiles\arrow-io-memory-test.dir\memory_test.cc.obj:(void __cdecl std::_Construct_in_place<class arrow::io::SlowInputStream, class std::shared_ptr<class arrow::io::BufferReader> &, double const &>(class arrow::io::SlowInputStream &, class std::shared_ptr<class arrow::io::BufferReader> &, double const &))
   >>> referenced by src\arrow\io\CMakeFiles\arrow-io-memory-test.dir\memory_test.cc.obj:(void __cdecl std::_Construct_in_place<class arrow::io::SlowInputStream, class std::shared_ptr<class arrow::io::BufferReader> &, double const &>(class arrow::io::SlowInputStream &, class std::shared_ptr<class arrow::io::BufferReader> &, double const &))
   ```




--

 };
 
 template <typename T>
-struct ARROW_EXPORT IntervalScalar : public TemporalScalar<T> {

Review comment:
       I think the reason is IntervalScalar contains some code (linker cannot find the constructor), but TimeScalar doesn't have code. Some scalars' implmentation code are in source files, they are also okay.
   But it doesn't explain why [Decimal128Scalar](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/scalar.h#L371) works.

fields.description:
Met with the errors when reviewing [PR|https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11383] to enable arrow above Windows on Arm64.
 Looks the issue is related to clang for windows, not arm. So I create a separated jira.

Some error logs:
{code:bash}
FAILED: debug/arrow-scalar-test.exe
.......
LINK Pass 1: command "C:\Users\linux\llvm-package\bin\lld-link.exe /nologo src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir\scalar_test.cc.obj /out:debug\arrow-scalar-test.exe /implib:debug\arrow-scalar-test.lib /pdb:debug\arrow-scalar-test.pdb /version:0.0 /machine:ARM64 /NODEFAULTLIB:LIBCMT /debug /INCREMENTAL /subsystem:console debug\arrow_testing.lib debug\arrow.lib utf8proc_ep-install\lib\utf8proc_static.lib re2_ep-install\lib\re2.lib googletest_ep-prefix\lib\gtest_maind.lib googletest_ep-prefix\lib\gtestd.lib googletest_ep-prefix\lib\gmockd.lib boost_ep-prefix\src\boost_ep\stage\lib\libboost_filesystem-vc142-mt-gd-x64-1_75.lib boost_ep-prefix\src\boost_ep\stage\lib\libboost_system-vc142-mt-gd-x64-1_75.lib ws2_32.lib kernel32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib winspool.lib shell32.lib ole32.lib oleaut32.lib uuid.lib comdlg32.lib advapi32.lib /MANIFEST /MANIFESTFILE:src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir/intermediate.manifest src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir/manifest.res" failed (exit code 1) with the following output:
lld-link: error: undefined symbol: __declspec(dllimport) public: __cdecl arrow::DateScalar<class arrow::Date32Type>::DateScalar<class arrow::Date32Type>(int)
>>> referenced by C:\Users\linux\arrow\cpp\src\arrow\scalar.h:320
>>>               src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir\scalar_test.cc.obj:(public: __cdecl arrow::Date32Scalar::Date32Scalar(int))
>>> referenced by C:\Users\linux\arrow\cpp\src\arrow\scalar.h:320
>>>               src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir\scalar_test.cc.obj:(public: __cdecl arrow::Date32Scalar::Date32Scalar(int))

lld-link: error: undefined symbol: __declspec(dllimport) public: __cdecl arrow::DateScalar<class arrow::Date64Type>::DateScalar<class arrow::Date64Type>(__int64)
>>> referenced by C:\Users\linux\arrow\cpp\src\arrow\scalar.h:324
>>>               src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir\scalar_test.cc.obj:(public: __cdecl arrow::Date64Scalar::Date64Scalar(__int64))
>>> referenced by C:\Users\linux\arrow\cpp\src\arrow\scalar.h:324
>>>               src\arrow\CMakeFiles\arrow-scalar-test.dir\scalar_test.cc.obj:(public: __cdecl arrow::Date64Scalar::Date64Scalar(__int64))
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
{code}
fields.summary: [C++] Fix build error from clang for windows
